title: Platoon leader describes gruelling search for Bergdahl
text:
San Antonio - Army Sergeant Bowe Bergdahl's commanding officer said on Thursday that his platoon was left "emotionally busted" by the physically and emotionally draining search for the US soldier after he went missing from their post in Afghanistan six years ago.
Testifying at the outset of a hearing to determine if Bergdahl should face a military trial on desertion and other charges, Captain John Billings described the weeks of searching for the soldier, often on little food or sleep and in temperatures in the high 90s (Fahrenheit)
"Physically, mentally, I was defeated," Billings said, adding that he felt like he had "failed" his men.
Billings said he thought his men were joking when they told him on June 30 2009 that Bergdahl had gone missing from their post in southeastern Afghanistan's Paktika Province.
